labels.analysis: The MCP Server described is primarily focused on project management and file operations within a controlled development environment. Its core functionality includes exploring project structures, managing files and directories, searching through code/files with advanced filtering, and checking for outdated dependencies. The tools provided enable secure file handling within allowed directories while enhancing developer productivity through intelligent project insights and dependency management.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Development Tools" was chosen because the server's tools are directly aimed at assisting developers in project management, file operations, and dependency checkingâ€”core activities in software development. The secondary label "File Management" was selected due to the server's extensive capabilities for file searching, renaming, and deleting within allowed directories. The "Database Operations" label is included because advanced file searching with filtering resembles database querying operations. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Project Explorer
server_info_crawled.author: @MausRundung362/mcp-explorer
server_info_crawled.overview: Explore and analyze project files with advanced search and management capabilities. Navigate project structures, detect imports/exports, manage dependencies, and perform safe file operations within allowed directories. Enhance your development workflow with intelligent project insights and secure file handling.

tools.name: explore_project
tools.description: Deploy Server Project Explorer @MausRundung362/mcp-explorer Try in Playground explore_project

tools.name: list_allowed_directories
tools.description: Returns the list of directories that this MCP server is allowed to access. This is useful for understanding which directories can be explored or searched before attempting to use other tools. The allowed directories are configured when the server starts and cannot be modified at runtime.

tools.name: search_files
tools.description: Advanced file and code search tool with comprehensive filtering and matching capabilities. Searches for patterns in files within allowed directories with support for regex patterns, file type filtering, size constraints, date filtering, and content preprocessing. When called without arguments, searches for common patterns in the current directory. Supports excluding comments and string literals for cleaner code searches. Results can be formatted as text, JSON, or structured output with configurable sorting and grouping options.

tools.name: rename_file
tools.description: Rename or move a file or directory. Can move files between directories and rename them in a single operation. If the destination exists, the operation will fail. Works across different directories and can be used for simple renaming within the same directory. Both source and destination must be within allowed directories.

tools.name: delete_file
tools.description: Delete a file or directory. Use with extreme caution as this operation cannot be undone. When deleting directories, all contents will be permanently removed. The recursive option must be explicitly set to true to delete non-empty directories. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: check_outdated
tools.description: Check for outdated npm packages in package.json using 'npm outdated'. Analyzes the current project's dependencies and shows which packages have newer versions available. Requires npm to be installed and accessible from the command line.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@MausRundung362/mcp-explorer/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
